data.enText: stood
stood
on feet/be vertical
to be on your feet; to be in a vertical position
She was too weak to stand.
a bird standing on one leg

data.chText: 别就那么直挺挺地站着——干点什么！
data.enText: Don't just stand there ─do something!

data.chText: 当时我就站在几英尺远的地方。
data.enText: I was standing only a few feet away.

data.chText: 我们分散站在过道里等着。
data.enText: We all stood around in the corridor waiting.
to stand on your head/hands (= to be upside down, balancing on your head/hands)

data.chText: 地震后只剩几座房子没倒。
data.enText: After the earthquake, only a few houses were left standing .
Stand still while I take your photo.
to get up onto your feet from another position

data.chText: 总统进来，大家都站了起来。
data.enText: Everyone stood when the President came in.

data.chText: 我们站起身来以便看得更清楚。
data.enText: We stood up in order to get a better view.
put upright
to put sth/sb in a vertical position somewhere
Stand the ladder up against the wall.

data.chText: 我让小女孩站到椅子上，好让她看得见。
data.enText: I stood the little girl on a chair so that she could see.
be in place/condition
to be in a particular place

data.chText: 那座城堡坐落在一片古战场上。
data.enText: The castle stands on the site of an ancient battlefield.

data.chText: 以前这儿长着一棵老橡树。
data.enText: An old oak tree once stood here.
to be in a particular condition or situation

data.chText: 那所房子空了好长一段时间。
data.enText: The house stood empty for a long time.

data.chText: “你把日期搞错了——是1988年。”“你说得对，是我搞错了。”
data.enText: ‘You're wrong about the date─it was 1988.’ ‘ I stand corrected (= accept that I was wrong) .’

data.chText: 你从来拿不准你和她的关系如何——她一会儿跟你亲热，一会儿连话也不大跟你说。
data.enText: You never know where you stand with her─one minute she's friendly, the next she'll hardly speak to you.

data.chText: 照目前的形势，尽快解决争端的可能微乎其微。
data.enText: As things stand , there is little chance of a quick settlement of the dispute.
be at height/level

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be a particular height
The tower stands 30 metres high.

data.chText: 达特定水平（或数量、高度等）
data.enText: to be at a particular level, amount, height, etc.
Interest rates stand at 3%.
The world record then stood at 6.59 metres.
of car/train, etc.
to be in a particular place, especially while waiting to go somewhere

data.chText: 停在第3站台的火车开往伦敦维多利亚站。
data.enText: The train standing at platform 3 is for London, Victoria.
of liquid/mixture
to remain still, without moving or being moved

data.chText: 搅好面糊以后，放上二十分钟。
data.enText: Mix the batter and let it stand for twenty minutes.
standing pools of rainwater
offer/decision
if an offer, a decision, etc. made earlier stands , it is still valid
My offer still stands.

data.chText: 那项世界纪录20年未被打破。
data.enText: The world record stood for 20 years.
be likely to do sth
to be in a situation where you are likely to do sth

data.chText: 你很可能会从这笔生意中大赚一笔。
data.enText: You stand to make a lot from this deal.
have opinion

data.chText: （对某事）持某种态度，有某一观点，采取某种立场
data.enText: to have a particular attitude or opinion about sth or towards sb

data.chText: 你对民办教育持什么观点？
data.enText: Where do you stand on private education?
dislike

data.chText: （尤用于否定句和疑问句，强调不喜欢）容忍，忍受

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: used especially in negative sentences and questions to emphasize that you do not like sb/sth
I can't stand his brother.
I can't stand the sight of blood.
I can't stand it when you do that.
She couldn't stand being kept waiting.

data.chText: 我不能容忍老有人打岔。
data.enText: I can't stand people interrupting all the time.

data.chText: 他老在这儿，你怎么受得了呢？
data.enText: How do you stand him being here all the time?
survive treatment

data.chText: （尤与can或could连用）经受，承受，经得起
data.enText: used especially with can/could to say that sb/sth can survive sth or can tolerate sth without being hurt or damaged

data.chText: 他的心脏对这种压力承受不了多久。
data.enText: His heart won't stand the strain much longer.

data.chText: 新型塑料能承受很高和很低的温度。
data.enText: Modern plastics can stand very high and very low temperatures.
buy drink/meal

data.chText: 花钱请（某人喝饮料或吃饭）；买…请客
data.enText: to buy a drink or meal for sb

data.chText: 他请客，让大家喝了饮料。
data.enText: He stood drinks all round.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She was kind enough to stand us a meal.
in election
run
to be a candidate in an election
He stood for parliament (= tried to get elected as an MP) .

data.chText: 她参加了地方选举，但未能当选。
data.enText: She stood unsuccessfully as a candidate in the local elections.

data.chText: 含 stand 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 stand on ceremony 在词条 ceremony 下。
data.enText: Idioms containing stand are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example stand on ceremony is at ceremony .
stand aside
to move to one side
She stood aside to let us pass.

data.chText: 不参与；不介入；置身事外
data.enText: to not get involved in sth

data.chText: 不要袖手旁观，工作都让别人去做。
data.enText: Don't stand aside and let others do all the work.

data.chText: 退居一旁；让位于他人；靠边
data.enText: to stop doing a job so sb else can do it
stand back (from sth)
to move back from a place
The police ordered the crowd to stand back.

data.chText: 位于离…有一段距离的地方
data.enText: to be located away from sth

data.chText: 房子离公路有一段距离。
data.enText: The house stands back from the road.
to think about a situation as if you are not involved in it

data.chText: 现在你该从旁观者的角度来看一看自己迄今取得的成就了。
data.enText: It's time to stand back and look at your career so far.
stand between sb/sth and sth
to prevent sb from getting or achieving sth

data.chText: 只要再赢一场比赛他就能胜出。
data.enText: Only one game stood between him and victory.
stand by
to be present while sth bad is happening but not do anything to stop it

data.chText: 你怎么能眼睁睁看着他遭人诬陷而袖手旁观呢？
data.enText: How can you stand by and see him accused of something he didn't do?

data.chText: 做好随时行动的准备；做好准备
data.enText: to be ready for action
The troops are standing by.
stand by sb
to help sb or be friends with them, even in difficult situations

data.chText: 她的著名歌曲《忠于你的男人》
data.enText: her famous song, ‘Stand by your man’
stand by sth

data.chText: 仍然遵守诺言（或协议等）
data.enText: to still believe or agree with sth you said, decided or agreed earlier

data.chText: 她依旧恪守她说过的每一句话。
data.enText: She still stands by every word she said.
stand down
to leave a job or position

data.chText: 他退下来好为年轻人让路。
data.enText: He stood down to make way for someone younger.
to leave the witness box/stand in court after giving evidence
stand for sth

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be an abbreviation or symbol of sth

data.chText: “这部书是T.C. Smith写的。”“T.C.是哪两个词的缩写？”
data.enText: ‘The book's by T.C. Smith.’ ‘What does the ‘T.C.’ stand for?’
to support sth

data.chText: 我厌恶那个组织，也厌恶它的一切主张。
data.enText: I hated the organization and all it stood for (= the ideas that it supported) .
to not let sb do sth or sth happen

data.chText: 这种事我再也不能容忍了。
data.enText: I'm not standing for it any longer.
stand in (for sb)
to take sb's place

data.chText: 我不在期间，由我的助手代替我。
data.enText: My assistant will stand in for me while I'm away.
stand out (as sth)
to be much better or more important than sb/sth

data.chText: 有四点比其余各点更为重要。
data.enText: Four points stand out as being more important than the rest.
stand out (from/against sth)
to be easily seen; to be noticeable

data.chText: 那种字体在深色背景下十分醒目。
data.enText: The lettering stood out well against the dark background.

data.chText: 她是那种在人群中很显眼的人。
data.enText: She's the sort of person who stands out in a crowd .
stand over sb
be near sb and watch them

data.chText: 我不喜欢做饭时你在一旁盯着我。
data.enText: I don't like you standing over me while I'm cooking.
stand up
to be on your feet

data.chText: 没有座位了，所以我只好站着。
data.enText: There were no seats left so I had to stand up.

data.chText: 站直身子，你会显得高些。
data.enText: You'll look taller if you stand up straight .
stand sb up

data.chText: （尤指恋人）故意失约使某人空等
data.enText: to deliberately not meet sb you have arranged to meet, especially sb you are having a romantic relationship with
I've been stood up!
stand up for sb/sth
to support or defend sb/sth

data.chText: 任何时候都要支持自己的朋友。
data.enText: Always stand up for your friends.

data.chText: 你必须维护自己的权利。
data.enText: You must stand up for your rights.
She had learnt to stand up for herself.
stand up (to sth)
to remain valid even when tested, examined closely, etc.

data.chText: 他的论点完全经不起仔细推敲。
data.enText: His argument simply doesn't stand up to close scrutiny.

data.chText: 恐怕这份文件在法庭上是根本站不住的。
data.enText: I'm afraid this document will never stand up in a court of law.
stand up to sb

data.chText: 抵抗；勇敢反对；不甘忍受某人的欺负（或不公平对待）
data.enText: to resist sb; to not accept bad treatment from sb without complaining

data.chText: 她不向那几个坏蛋屈服，真是勇敢。
data.enText: It was brave of her to stand up to those bullies.
stand up to sth
to remain in good condition despite rough treatment

data.chText: 这种地毯设计得十分耐用。
data.enText: The carpet is designed to stand up to a lot of wear and tear.
opinion
an attitude towards sth or an opinion that you make clear to people

data.chText: 在某事上采取坚定的立场
data.enText: to take a firm stand on sth

data.chText: 他因在移民问题上立场强硬受到批评。
data.enText: He was criticized for his tough stand on immigration.
defence
a strong effort to defend yourself or your opinion about sth

data.chText: 我们必须采取措施，防止进一步裁员。
data.enText: We must make a stand against further job losses.

data.chText: 反叛者最后的疯狂抵抗
data.enText: the rebels' desperate last stand
for showing/holding sth
a table or a vertical structure that goods are sold from, especially in the street or at a market
a hamburger/newspaper stand

data.chText: （展示或推介物品的）桌，台，摊位
data.enText: a table or a vertical structure where things are displayed or advertised, for example at an exhibition
a display/an exhibition/a trade stand
a piece of equipment or furniture that you use for holding a particular type of thing

data.chText: 自行车停靠架、麦克风架、蛋糕座等
data.enText: a bicycle/microphone/cake, etc. stand
at sports ground
a large sloping structure at a stadium with rows where people sit or stand to watch the game
in court
He took the stand as the first witness.
in cricket

data.chText: 两个击球员同时在场上并跑动得分的阶段；双人配对
data.enText: the period of time in which two people who are batting (= hitting the ball) play together and score points

data.chText: 克林奇和哈里斯两位击球员，比赛一开始时搭档，共得69分。
data.enText: Clinch and Harris shared an opening stand of 69.
for band/orchestra, etc.

data.chText: （用于演出或演讲等的）舞台，高台，台
data.enText: a raised platform for a band, an orchestra , a speaker, etc.
for taxis/buses, etc.
a place where taxis, buses, etc. park while they are waiting for passengers
of plants/trees
a group of plants or trees of one kind
a stand of pines
of land
a piece of land that you can buy and use for building a house, etc. on

data.chText: 开发商买下这块土地将其分为多块建筑用地。
data.enText: A developer bought the land and divided it into stands.

data.text: stand ♦ get up ♦ stand up ♦ rise ♦ get to your feet ♦ be on your feet

data.chText: 以上各词均含站立、直立、站起来之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to be in an upright position with your weight on your feet, or to put yourself in this position.
stand
to be in an upright position with your weight on your feet
She was too weak to stand.
Stand still when I'm talking to you!

data.chText: stand通常与副词或介词短语连用，表示站的地方或方式，但有时也与另一短语或从句连用，表明站着时在做某事：
data.enText: Stand is usually used with an adverb or prepositional phrase to show where or how sb stands, but sometimes another phrase or clause is used to show what sb does while they are standing.
We stood talking for a few minutes.
He stood and looked out to sea.
get up

data.chText: 指从坐、跪或躺的姿势站起来：
data.enText: to get into a standing position from a sitting, kneeling or lying position
Please don't get up!
stand up
to be in a standing position; to stand after sitting
Stand up straight!

data.chText: 老师走进教室时大家都会起立。
data.enText: Everyone would stand up when the teacher entered the classroom.

data.chText: stand通常含站立、直立之义，但亦含站起来、起来之义。stand up用于上述两种意思均可，但其用法较受限制，主要用于指让某人站起来或某人只得站着（如没地方坐）。get up 是表达从坐着、跪着或躺着的姿势站起来、起立、起身最常用的方法；stand up 则几乎总是指从坐着的姿势，尤指从椅子上站起来：
data.enText: Stand usually means ‘to be in a standing position’ but can also mean ‘to get into a standing position’. Stand up can be used with either of these meanings, but its use is more restricted: it is used especially when sb tells sb or a group of people to stand, or when sb has to stand up (for example, because there is nowhere to sit). Get up is the most frequent way of saying ‘get into a standing position’, and this can be from a sitting, kneeling or lying position; if you stand up , this is nearly always after sitting, especially on a chair.
I stood up from the grass.

data.chText: 如果想礼貌地告诉某人不必从椅子上起来，用get up：
data.enText: If you want to tell sb politely that they do not need to move from their chair, use get up .
Please don't stand up!
stand, get up or stand up?
rise

data.chText: 指从坐、跪或躺的姿势站起来：
data.enText: ( formal ) to get into a standing position from a sitting, kneeling or lying position

data.chText: 请大家起立，欢迎我们的演讲嘉宾。
data.enText: Would you all rise, please, to welcome our visiting speaker.
get to your feet
to stand up after sitting, kneeling or lying
I helped her to get to her feet.
be on your feet
to be standing up
I've been on my feet all day.
to get up/stand up/rise from sth
to stand/get up/stand up/rise/get to your feet quickly/slowly
to stand/stand up straight

word_means: 持某种态度，有某一观点，采取某种立场
两个击球员同时在场上并跑动得分的阶段

means: （对某事）持某种态度，有某一观点，采取某种立场
两个击球员同时在场上并跑动得分的阶段

ex.chText: 一个坚强的人会忍受困苦而不抱怨。
ex.enText: A strong man will bear hardship without complaining.

ex.chText: 睡在冷冰冰的床上我受不了。
ex.enText: I cannot bear sleeping in a cold bed.

ex.chText: 她担心她的朋友忍受不了这种痛苦。
ex.enText: She was afraid that her friend wouldn't be able to bear the pain.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指忍受饥饿、寒冷、疼痛、不幸、困难、侮辱等，多强调忍受者的勇敢和坚毅。

ex.chText: 请安静点！我再也忍受不了这吵闹声了。
ex.enText: Be quiet! I can't endure the racket any longer.

ex.chText: 作为黑人运动员，他经常得忍受种族歧视性的奚落。
ex.enText: As a Black player, he often has to endure racist taunts.

ex.chText: 忍受苦难需要耐力。
ex.enText: It takes patience to endure hardship.

ex.chText: 她渴望一份能经受住一切考验的爱情。
ex.enText: She longs for a love that can endure all things.

synonyms.bx: 强调长期性，主要指对灾难、困难、疼痛等长时间地忍受而不抱怨。

ex.chText: 他们经受住了自然灾害的考验。
ex.enText: They stood the test of natural calamity.

ex.chText: 你怎么能忍受那种噪音呢?
ex.enText: How can you stand/bear that noise?

ex.chText: 这类谬论我再也听不下去了。
ex.enText: I cannot stand/bear to hear such fallacies any more.

ex.chText: 她不能容忍丈夫老是晚回家。
ex.enText: She cannot stand/bear her husband coming home late all the time.

synonyms.bx: 作“经受”解时，常与 could 或 can 连用，指某人或某物经得起伤害等；作“忍受”解时，主要指对某人、某种困难情况的忍受或承受，通常用于疑问句和否定句中，常可与 bear 换用。

ex.chText: 他队中的两名士兵受了重伤。
ex.enText: Two soldiers from his squad sustained serious injuries.

ex.chText: 好几家公司都因不正当竞争而遭受了严重的经济损失。
ex.enText: Several companies have sustained heavy financial losses due to the unfair competition.

synonyms.bx: 指受到损害、创伤或金钱方面的损失。

ex.chText: 当然，我们这里容许发表各种意见。
ex.enText: Surely, we tolerate all opinions here.

ex.chText: 人道主义不能容忍这种罪行。
ex.enText: Humanity cannot tolerate such guilt.

ex.chText: 这是她所无法忍受的。
ex.enText: This is more than she can tolerate.

synonyms.bx: 指以克制的态度容忍令人反感或厌恶的事物，含默认、宽容之意。

ex.chText: 该党对于教育改革持什么态度？
ex.enText: What is the party's position on education reform?

ex.chText: 董事会认为拓展海外市场的时机已经成熟。
ex.enText: The board took the position that the time was ripe for expanding the overseas market.

synonyms.bx: 尤指政府、政党、当权者对某一事件、问题等的意见。

ex.chText: 他有着积极的生活态度。
ex.enText: He has a positive attitude towards life.

ex.chText: 我真的无法理解他对歌手的看法。
ex.enText: I really can't understand his attitude towards singers.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某事物的一般看法。

ex.chText: 他被指责在环境问题上没有立场。
ex.enText: He was accused of not taking a stand on environmental issues.

ex.chText: 共和党在这件事情上所持的保守立场颇受关注。
ex.enText: The Republicans' conservative stand on this matter has attracted much attention.

synonyms.bx: 指公开表明的坚定看法。

data.chText: 含 stand 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 stand on ceremony 在词条 ceremony 下。
data.enText: Idioms containing stand are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example stand on ceremony is at ceremony .

data.chText: 他们坚决反对校园吸毒现象。
data.enText: They took a firm stand against drugs in the school.
stand aside

data.enText: He stood down to make way for someone younger.
to leave the witness box/stand in court after giving evidence
stand for sth

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be an abbreviation or symbol of sth

data.chText: “这部书是T.C. Smith写的。”“T.C.是哪两个词的缩写？”
data.enText: ‘The book's by T.C. Smith.’ ‘What does the ‘T.C.’ stand for?’
to support sth

data.chText: 我厌恶那个组织，也厌恶它的一切主张。
data.enText: I hated the organization and all it stood for (= the ideas that it supported) .
to not let sb do sth or sth happen

data.chText: 这种事我再也不能容忍了。
data.enText: I'm not standing for it any longer.
stand in (for sb)
to take sb's place

data.chText: 我不在期间，由我的助手代替我。
data.enText: My assistant will stand in for me while I'm away.
stand out (as sth)
to be much better or more important than sb/sth

data.chText: 有四点比其余各点更为重要。
data.enText: Four points stand out as being more important than the rest.
stand out (from/against sth)
to be easily seen; to be noticeable

data.chText: 那种字体在深色背景下十分醒目。
data.enText: The lettering stood out well against the dark background.

data.chText: 她是那种在人群中很显眼的人。
data.enText: She's the sort of person who stands out in a crowd .
stand over sb
be near sb and watch them

data.chText: 我不喜欢做饭时你在一旁盯着我。
data.enText: I don't like you standing over me while I'm cooking.
stand up
to be on your feet

data.chText: 没有座位了，所以我只好站着。
data.enText: There were no seats left so I had to stand up.

data.chText: 站直身子，你会显得高些。
data.enText: You'll look taller if you stand up straight .
stand sb up

data.chText: （尤指恋人）故意失约使某人空等
data.enText: to deliberately not meet sb you have arranged to meet, especially sb you are having a romantic relationship with
I've been stood up!
stand up for sb/sth
to support or defend sb/sth

data.chText: 任何时候都要支持自己的朋友。
data.enText: Always stand up for your friends.

data.chText: 你必须维护自己的权利。
data.enText: You must stand up for your rights.
She had learnt to stand up for herself.
stand up (to sth)
to remain valid even when tested, examined closely, etc.

data.chText: 他的论点完全经不起仔细推敲。
data.enText: His argument simply doesn't stand up to close scrutiny.

data.chText: 恐怕这份文件在法庭上是根本站不住的。
data.enText: I'm afraid this document will never stand up in a court of law.
stand up to sb

data.chText: 抵抗；勇敢反对；不甘忍受某人的欺负（或不公平对待）
data.enText: to resist sb; to not accept bad treatment from sb without complaining

data.chText: 她不向那几个坏蛋屈服，真是勇敢。
data.enText: It was brave of her to stand up to those bullies.
stand up to sth
to remain in good condition despite rough treatment

data.chText: 这种地毯设计得十分耐用。
data.enText: The carpet is designed to stand up to a lot of wear and tear.

trans: （从要职上）退下，下台（让位给他人）
置身事外，退一步（考虑问题）
继续支持（身处困境的人）
坚持，遵守，信守（原有的决定、承诺或宣言）
（某个字母）是…的缩写，代表，表示
支持，主张，代表（某种观点或态度）
（在别人生病或不在时）替代，代替
（要求或证据）经得起检验，能够成立
对抗，抗争（比自己强的人）

example: the army made a final stand at the Rhone

tr: a stop made by a touring musical or theatrical group to give a performance
example: a one-night stand

tr: a platform where a (brass) band can play in the open air

example: the base of the lamp

tr: a support for displaying various articles
example: the newspapers were arranged on a rack

tr: a booth where articles are displayed for sale
tiered seats consisting of a structure (often made of wood) where people can sit to watch an event (game or parade)
a small table for holding articles of various kinds
example: a bedside stand

tr: a mental position from which things are viewed
example: we should consider this problem from the viewpoint of the Russians
teaching history gave him a special point of view toward current events

tr: a growth of similar plants (usually trees) in a particular area
example: they cut down a stand of trees

tr: the position where a thing or person stands
put up with something or somebody unpleasant
example: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage

tr: have or maintain a position or stand on an issue
example: Where do you stand on the War?
The trees resisted her
stand the test of time
The mountain climbers had to fend against the ice and snow
male domestic animals such as stallions serve selected females
We had to stand for the entire performance!
Can you stand the bookshelf up?

tr: be in some specified state or condition
example: I stand corrected
I am standing my ground and won't give in!
She stands 6 feet tall
The law stands!
standing water

tr: occupy a place or location, also metaphorically
example: We stand on common ground

value.def: When you are standing, your body is upright, your legs are straight, and your weight is supported by your feet.

example.ex: She was standing beside my bed staring down at me...
example.tran: 她站在我的床边低头盯着我。

example.ex: They told me to stand still and not to turn round...
example.tran: 他们叫我站着不动，不要转身。

example.ex: Overcrowding is so bad that prisoners have to sleep in shifts, while others have to stand.
example.tran: 过度拥挤的现象十分严重，囚犯们不得不轮流睡觉，其他人则只能站着。

example.ex: We waited, standing up, for an hour.
example.tran: 我们站着等了 1 小时。

example.ex: ...Mrs Fletcher, a shop assistant who has to stand up all day.
example.tran: 弗莱彻夫人，一位整天都得站着的售货员

value.def: When someone who is sitting stands, they change their position so that they are upright and on their feet.

example.ex: Becker stood and shook hands with Ben.
example.tran: 贝克尔站起来和本握手。

example.ex: When I walked in, they all stood up and started clapping.
example.tran: 当我走进去时，他们全都起立鼓掌。

value.def: If you stand aside or stand back, you move a short distance sideways or backwards, so that you are standing in a different place.

example.ex: I stood aside to let her pass me...
example.tran: 我站到一边，让她从我身旁过去。

example.ex: The policemen stood back. Could it be a bomb?
example.tran: 警察们往后退了退。这会是个炸弹吗？

value.def: If something such as a building or a piece of furniture stands somewhere, it is in that position, and is upright.

example.ex: The house stands alone on top of a small hill...
example.tran: 房子孤零零地坐落在一座小山顶上。

example.ex: I reached for the lamp, which stood in the middle of the table.
example.tran: 我伸手去够位于桌子中央的灯。

value.def: You can say that a building is standing when it remains after other buildings around it have fallen down or been destroyed.

example.ex: The palace, which was damaged by bombs in World War II, still stood...
example.tran: 二战中遭到轰炸的那座宫殿依然矗立着。

example.ex: There are very few buildings left standing.
example.tran: 几乎没有几个建筑物留存下来。

value.tran: (建筑物在周围其他建筑物倒塌或被毁后)依然存在，矗立

value.def: If you stand something somewhere, you put it there in an upright position.

example.ex: Stand the plant in the open in a sunny, sheltered place.
example.tran: 把这株植物放在一个阳光充足、上方有遮盖物的开阔处。

value.def: If you leave food or a mixture of something to stand, you leave it without disturbing it for some time.

example.ex: The salad improves if made in advance and left to stand.
example.tran: 色拉如果能事先做好再搁置一会儿，味道会更好。

value.tran: (将食物或调拌物等)搁置不动

value.def: If you take or make a stand, you do something or say something in order to make it clear what your attitude to a particular thing is.

example.ex: He felt the need to make a stand against racism in South Africa...
example.tran: 他感觉有必要表明自己对南非的种族主义持反对态度。

example.ex: They must take a stand and cast their votes...
example.tran: 他们必须表明立场并投票。

example.ex: His tough stand won some grudging admiration.
example.tran: 他的强硬态度使得一些对他不满的人也不由得感到钦佩。

value.def: If you ask someone where or how they stand on a particular issue, you are asking them what their attitude or view is.

example.ex: The amendment will force senators to show where they stand on the issue of sexual harassment...
example.tran: 修订案将迫使参议员们表明自己对性骚扰问题的立场。

example.ex: So far, the bishop hasn't said where he stands.
example.tran: 迄今为止，主教还没有表明自己的态度。

value.def: If you do not know where you stand with someone, you do not know exactly what their attitude to you is.

example.ex: No-one knows where they stand with him; he is utterly unpredictable...
example.tran: 谁也不知道他怎样看待他们;他是个完全不可捉摸的人。

example.ex: All children need discipline, to know where they stand.
example.tran: 所有孩子都需要管教，让他们知道别人如何看待自己。

value.def: You can use stand instead of 'be' when you are describing the present state or condition of something or someone.

example.ex: The alliance stands ready to do what is necessary...
example.tran: 联盟已准备好采取必要行动。

example.ex: He stands accused of destroying the party in pursuit of his presidential ambitions...
example.tran: 他被指责为实现自己当总统的野心而不惜毁灭该党。

example.ex: The peace plan as it stands violates basic human rights.
example.tran: 该和平计划本身违反了基本人权。

value.def: If a decision, law, or offer stands, it still exists and has not been changed or cancelled.

example.ex: Although exceptions could be made, the rule still stands...
example.tran: 虽然可能有例外，但该规定仍然有效。

example.ex: The Supreme Court says that the convictions can stand.
example.tran: 最高法院说判决结果依然有效。

value.def: If something that can be measured stands at a particular level, it is at that level.

example.ex: The inflation rate now stands at 3.6 per cent...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率目前为 3.6%。

example.ex: Support for the two sides is standing at between 42 and 44 per cent.
example.tran: 双方的支持率在 42%和 44%之间。

value.def: You can describe how tall or high someone or something is by saying that they stand a particular height.

example.ex: She stood five feet five inches tall and weighed 120 pounds...
example.tran: 她身高 5 英尺 5 英寸，体重 120 磅。

example.ex: The dam will stand 600 feet high...
example.tran: 大坝将高达 600 英尺。

example.ex: She stood tall and aloof.
example.tran: 她人很高，很冷漠。

value.def: If something can stand a situation or a test, it is good enough or strong enough to experience it without being damaged, harmed, or shown to be inadequate.

example.ex: These are the first machines that can stand the wear and tear of continuously crushing glass...
example.tran: 这些就是第一批能经受住不停碾碎玻璃所造成的磨损的机器。

example.ex: I think these books can stand comparison quite happily with works by Dickens...
example.tran: 我认为这些书能和狄更斯的作品相媲美。

example.ex: Ancient wisdom has stood the test of time.
example.tran: 古老的智慧已经经受了时间的考验。

value.tran: 经得起，承受得住(困难、考验)

value.def: If you cannot stand something, you cannot bear it or tolerate it.

example.ex: I can't stand any more. I'm going to run away...
example.tran: 我再也受不了了。我要逃走。

example.ex: Stoddart can stand any amount of personal criticism...
example.tran: 不管有多少针对他的个人批评，斯托达特都可以忍受。

example.ex: How does he stand the pain?
example.tran: 这种疼痛他能忍受吗？

value.def: If you cannot stand someone or something, you dislike them very strongly.

example.ex: I can't stand that man and his arrogance...
example.tran: 我讨厌那个男人和他的傲慢。

example.ex: He can't stand me smoking.
example.tran: 他受不了我抽烟。

value.def: If you stand to gain something, you are likely to gain it. If you stand to lose something, you are likely to lose it.

example.ex: The management group would stand to gain millions of dollars if the company were sold...
example.tran: 如果该公司被卖掉，管理层会获得几百万美元。

example.ex: As many as 30,000 workers at 22 nuclear weapons sites stand to lose their jobs.
example.tran: 在 22 个核武器制造点工作的多达 3 万名工人可能会失业。

value.tran: 可能获得/ 可能失去

value.def: If you stand in an election, you are a candidate in it.

example.ex: He has not yet announced whether he will stand in the election...
example.tran: 他尚未宣布自己是否会参选。

example.ex: Some ardent supporters were urging him to stand...
example.tran: 一些热心支持者正在力劝他参选。

example.ex: She is to stand as a Member of the European Parliament...
example.tran: 她将竞选欧洲议会议员。

example.ex: Every two years all the congressmen stand for re-election.
example.tran: 所有国会议员每两年重新选举一次。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 run

value.def: If you stand someone a meal or a drink, you buy it for them.

example.ex: You can stand me a pint.
example.tran: 你可以请我喝一品脱啤酒。

value.def: A stand is a small shop or stall, outdoors or in a large public building.

example.ex: He ran a newspaper stand outside the American Express office...
example.tran: 他在美国运通公司办公大楼外经营一家报摊。

example.ex: She bought a hot dog from a stand on a street corner.
example.tran: 她从街角的小摊上买了个热狗。

value.tran: (设在户外或大型公共建筑物内的)小店，售货摊

value.def: A stand at a sports ground is a large structure where people sit or stand to watch what is happening.

posc.def: In American English, stands is used with same meaning.

example.ex: The people in the stands at Candlestick Park are standing and cheering with all their might.
example.tran: 烛台体育场看台上的人们都站在那里拼命喊加油。

value.def: A stand is an object or piece of furniture that is designed for supporting or holding a particular kind of thing.

example.ex: The teapot came with a stand to catch the drips.
example.tran: 那把茶壶配有一个可以接滴水的茶托。

value.def: A stand is an area where taxis or buses can wait to pick up passengers.

example.ex: Luckily there was a taxi stand nearby.
example.tran: 幸好附近就有一个出租车候客处。

value.tran: (出租车、公共汽车的)停车候客处

value.def: In a law court, the stand is the place where a witness stands to answer questions.

example.ex: When the father took the stand today, he contradicted his son's testimony...
example.tran: 那位父亲今天出庭作证时，驳斥了自己儿子的证词。

example.ex: The government has called nearly 50 witnesses to the stand.
example.tran: 政府已传招了近 50 名证人出庭。

value.def: If an idea, claim, or attempt stands or falls on something, its truth or success depends on that thing.

example.ex: Airlines should stand or fall on their ability to attract passengers.
example.tran: 航空公司的成败应该取决于它们吸引乘客的能力。

value.tran: 真实性取决于;成败在于

value.def: You can describe someone's final attempt to defend themselves before they are defeated as their last stand .

example.ex: There they made their tragic and heroic last stand against the Roman legions.
example.tran: 他们在那里对罗马军团进行了最后的抵抗，场面英勇而悲壮。

value.def: If you say it stands to reason that something is true or likely to happen, you mean that it is obvious.

example.ex: It stands to reason that if you are considerate and friendly to people you will get a lot more back...
example.tran: 显然，如果你通情达理，对人友善，那么你肯定会获得更多回报。

example.ex: Smith isn't his real name, that stands to reason.
example.tran: 很显然，史密斯不是他的真名。

value.def: If you stand in the way of something or stand in a person's way, you prevent that thing from happening or prevent that person from doing something.

example.ex: The British government would not stand in the way of such a proposal...
example.tran: 英国政府不会阻止这样一项提议。

example.ex: It is his decision to go to America and who am I to stand in his way?
example.tran: 去美国是他的决定，我凭什么要阻拦他？

xrse.def: to stand up and be counted
to stand on your own two feet
to stand someone in good stead

trans: 站；立；站立；起立；站起来；（要求或证据）经得起检验，能够成立；（男友或女友）爽约，放…的鸽子
替补；（在别人生病或不在时）替代，代替
坚持；向一个方向笔直航行
好坏；存亡绝续；不论成败
代表；容忍；（某个字母）是…的缩写；表示；支持；主张（某种观点或态度）
脱颖而出；突出；引人注目；显眼；出色；更为重要；凸起；凸出
袖手旁观；做好准备；准备行动；坐视不理；继续支持（身处困境的人）；坚持，遵守，信守（原有的决定、承诺或宣言）
量子理论的原来形式；按这种样子
坚定不移;坚持己见;拒不让步
